IRenderer.h

This file defines the published interface for the renderer.

MeshData

Defines class for holding mesh data (i.e. vertices and indices)

Members
m_spVB

The vertex buffer

m_spIB

The index buffer (maybe null)

m_vertexSize

Size in bytes of each vertex

m_numVertices

Number of vertices

m_numIndices

Number of indices. Maybe 0

Header

Rendering/Caustic/IRenderer.h

Pass Flags
c_PassFirst

first pass

c_PassObjID

renders pass writing object IDs to output texture

c_PassShadow

pass that renders shadow maps

c_PassOpaque

pass rendering the opaque objects

c_PassTransparent

pass rendering transparent objects

c_PassEnvironment

pass rendering environment maps

c_PassLast

last pass

c_PassAllPasses

combination of all the pass flags

Shadow map selection
c_HiResShadowMap

selects the hi-res shadow map

c_MidResShadowMap

selects the mid-res shadow map

c_LowResShadowMap

selects the low-res shadow map

Header

Rendering/Caustic/Renderer.h

IRenderer

Defines our basic renderer. IRenderer handles all rendering commands.  It is generally expected that this object is running on its own thread.

Header

Rendering/Caustic/IRenderer.h

const wchar_t *pFolder
) = 0

Parameters

const wchar_t*

folder from which to load shaders

SetPostEffect

Assigns a GPUImaging pipeline that is to run as a series of post effects on the final render buffer.

Parameters
pPipeline

defines a GPU pipeline to run on the final rendered image

virtual void SetPostEffect(IGPUPipeline* pPipeline) = 0;

DrawScreenQuad
virtual void DrawScreenQuad(
float minU,
float minV,
float maxU,
float maxV,
ITexture *pTexture,
ISampler *pSampler
) = 0

Renders a quad on the display at the specified uv coordinates.  A full screen quad runs from 0.0,0.0 => 1.0,1.0

Parameters
minU
float

minimum U

minV
float

minimum V

maxU
float

maximum U

maxV
float

maximum V

pTexture
ITexture*

Texture to render on quad

pSampler
ISampler*

Sampler to use. Maybe nullptr

Setup
virtual void Setup(
HWND hwnd,
std::wstring &shaderFolder,
bool createDebugDevice,
bool startFrozen = false
) = 0

Initializes the renderer. Applications need to call this method at startup.

Parameters
hwnd
HWND

window to bind renderer to

shaderFolder
std::wstring&

path to shader folder

createDebugDevice
bool

True if application wants the debug D3D device. False otherwise.

startFrozen
bool

start renderer in a frozen state.

DrawMesh
virtual void DrawMesh(
IRenderSubMesh *pMesh,
IMaterialAttrib *pMaterial,
ITexture *pTexture,
IShader *pShader,
DirectX::XMMATRIX &mat
) = 0

Renders a mesh by adding it to the Renderable list that is drawn each time a frame is rendered

TODO: This method needs to be refactored. There is no point in sending in both a pMaterial and a pTexture (the material already should define the diffuse texture). Also, we should pass in both a front and back face material

Parameters
pMesh
IRenderSubMesh*

mesh to render

pMaterial
IMaterialAttrib*

material for front faces

pTexture
ITexture*

texture for diffuse component

pShader
IShader*

shader to use to draw mesh

mat
DirectX::XMMATRIX&

matrix to transform mesh by

int lightMapIndex,
Vector3 &lightPos,
Vector3 &lightDir
) = 0

Setups up our shadow map as the current render target

int

constant indicating which shadow map to use (c_HiResShadow, ...)

Vector3&

lightDir
Vector3&

virtual void PopShadowmapRT() = 0
